Aerosols are fine particles like soot or sulfur compounds, mostly from burning fuel.
They seed a kind of cloud that's especially good at reflecting solar radiation back into space.
Even on their own, without clouds, these aerosols are kind of like sun block.
Volcanoes create aerosols too, but air pollution appears to produce more and then they sweep across the Atlantic sky.
Booth has calculated their effect on sea surface temperature swings.

If they're right, human activity has a huge influence on just so many climate processes around the Atlantic Ocean.
